security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with documentation and helper scripts. Minimal audit performed per policy. No security findings noted in scanned files.

content.user_title: Build MCP servers with best practices
content.value_statement: Building an MCP server can fail without clear tool design and evaluation. This guide provides workflows, patterns, and evaluation scripts for reliable MCP servers.
actual_capabilities: Provides a four phase workflow for MCP server research, implementation, testing, and evaluation.
Includes TypeScript MCP SDK patterns with registerTool, Zod schemas, and transport setup.
Includes Python FastMCP patterns with Pydantic models, context injection, and resources.
Supplies an evaluation XML format and example evaluation file.
Ships a Python evaluation harness that calls MCP tools over stdio, SSE, or streamable HTTP.
limitations: Does not include a runnable MCP server implementation.
External SDK documentation must be fetched from the web links.
Evaluation script requires Anthropic API access and an MCP server endpoint.
Examples may need adaptation for specific APIs and authentication.

use_cases.title: Design a new server
use_cases.description: Use the workflow to plan tools, schemas, and transports for a new MCP integration.

use_cases.title: Set evaluation coverage
use_cases.description: Use the evaluation guide and script to test server usefulness with stable questions.

use_cases.title: Document server standards
use_cases.description: Use best practices to create consistent naming, pagination, and error guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Plan an MCP server
prompt_templates.prompt: I am new to MCP. Create a step by step plan to build a server for the Example API, including tool naming and transport choice.

prompt_templates.title: Define tool schemas
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft Zod or Pydantic input schemas for user search and issue creation tools, with constraints and response formats.

prompt_templates.title: Create evaluation set
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 10 read only evaluation questions for a GitHub MCP server and include the exact XML structure.

prompt_templates.title: Audit tool quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my tool list and descriptions for naming, pagination, and error handling gaps, then give prioritized fixes.

output_examples.input: Outline the phases and key tasks to build a reliable MCP server.
output: Phase 1: Review MCP best practices and the target API
Phase 2: Implement tools with validated schemas and annotations
Phase 3: Build and test with MCP Inspector
Phase 4: Create 10 evaluation questions in XML format

best_practices: Follow naming conventions for servers and tools to avoid collisions.
Validate all inputs with Zod or Pydantic and provide clear error messages.
Support pagination and response_format for large result sets.
anti_patterns: Using deprecated MCP SDK APIs instead of registerTool or FastMCP.
Returning unbounded data without pagination or truncation.
Embedding API keys in code or logs.

faq.question: Which platforms can use this skill?
faq.answer: It is documentation plus scripts and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code where Python can run.

faq.question: What are the limits of the evaluation script?
faq.answer: It requires a reachable MCP server and runs only the questions defined in the XML file.

faq.question: How do I integrate it with my MCP server?
faq.answer: Point the evaluation script at your server using stdio, SSE, or HTTP transport options.

faq.question: Does it send my data to external services?
faq.answer: The evaluation script sends prompts to Claude through the Anthropic API.

faq.question: What if the script cannot connect?
faq.answer: Verify the transport settings, server URL or command, and required environment variables.

faq.question: How is this different from generic MCP docs?
faq.answer: It adds workflow steps, language specific patterns, and a ready evaluation harness.
